Description: Handle-plate with part of handle of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; underside and handle attachment glazed black; on top, black-figure decoration consisting of head of bearded man to left, with added red on face and neck, incised fillet and long hair; edges of handle plate, including top of neck, red.
Curator's comments: In his journal for 1884-5, p.32, Petrie mentions acquiring two handle-plates like this. This may not therefore be from excavation.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.21)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 16)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 270, no. B208)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0142) (Phase 1)
